text: Who loves to peer up at the morning sun, With half-shut eyes and comfortable cheek,
With half-shut eyes and comfortable cheek, Let him with this sweet tale full often seek
Let him with this sweet tale full often seek%% For meadows where the little rivers run;
For meadows where the little rivers run; Who loves to linger with that brightest one
Who loves to linger with that brightest one%% Of Heaven -- Hesperus -- let him lowly speak
Of Heaven -- Hesperus -- let him lowly speak%% These numbers to the night and starlight meek,
These numbers to the night and starlight meek, Or moon, if that her hunting be begun.
Or moon, if that her hunting be begun. He who knows these delights, and, too, is prone
He who knows these delights, and, too, is prone%% To moralize upon a smile or tear,
To moralize upon a smile or tear, Will find at once a region of his own,
Will find at once a region of his own, A bower for his spirit, and will steer
A bower for his spirit, and will steer%% To alleys where the fir-tree drops its cone,
To alleys where the fir-tree drops its cone, Where robins hop, and fallen leaves are sear.
